page.title: 06Eating out in Stone
page.content: There are several places in and around Stone where one can dine out in elegant, pleasant surroundings.In the High Street is the Crown Hotel,formerly a coaching inn but now a spacious hotel recommended by both the A.A.and R.A.C. It consists of the Harding Room for dinner dances, parties, etc., the Jervis Room for small parties,the Oak Panelled restaurant,the Ballroom, lounge bars and luxurious bedrooms. The Mill,in Mill Street,was originally a corn mill,but now serves three course meals plus a variety of wines.Wedding parties are also catered for.In its days as a working mill the first sack of Hovis flour was ground there. The Darlaston Inn and the Wayfarer, both situated on the main A.34,are traditional pub restaurants where you dine or visit for a drink.For Granville's Restaurant see pages 7 & 8.
